sentence.Network_en: I attempted a classic rock and roll quiff.
sentence.Network_cn: 我尝试着做了一个经典的摇滚飞机头。

list.abs: and she also win a lot of honor in various Chinese painting and writing compitetions.Miss Yan has brought a quiff of breeze to nowaday's field of painting with her refined art .她的作品题材广泛、种类全面，清新又不失大气，将一种脱俗的高雅气质融入自己的笔下，给当今的画坛带来一股春风。

derivation.yuyuan_name: late 19th cent. (originally denoting a lock of hair plastered down on the forehead, especially as worn by soldiers): of unknown origin

entry.def: If a man has a quiff, his hair has been combed upwards and backwards from his forehead.

example.ex: I attempted a classic rock and roll quiff.
example.tran: 我尝试着做了一个经典的摇滚飞机头。

means.word_mean: 1. a prominent forelock (especially one brushed upward from the forehead)

auth_sentence.content: An Australian ted who'd had his quiff flattened.

auth_sentence.res_content_con: An Australian ted who'd had his quiff flattened.

auth_sentence.content: He also has a big stand-up quiff, like a cross between Tintin and Jedward.

auth_sentence.res_content_con: He also has a big stand-up quiff, like a cross between Tintin and Jedward.
